results.title: Rhabdomyolysis in association with simvastatin and amiodarone.
results.text_hl: CASE SUMMARY: A 63-year-old white man with underlying @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1 @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@insulin-dependent diabetes@@@, recent coronary artery bypass surgery, and @<m>DISEASE_Hemiplegia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006429 @@@postoperative hemiplegia@@@ was treated with @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@aspirin@@@, @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Furosemide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005665 @@@furosemide@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nitroglycerin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005996 @@@nitroglycerin@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Roten L, Schoenenberger RA, Krähenbühl S, Schlienger RG. Rhabdomyolysis in association with simvastatin and amiodarone. Ann Pharmacother. 2004 Jun;38(6):978-81. PMID: 15069169
